data.title: Provide Lua and tolua headers in SDK installation
data.body: I'm reconfiguring some projects to work with the new build installation, and in the process have found opportunity to try to clarify how I find include paths. So far, I've been hard-wiring include paths for lua.h and tolua++.h, but I was wondering if we should make those more readily available. I noticed that when doing a make install, the install script will copy some ThirdParty includes such as AngelScript, the physics libs and SDL. I think that in order to facilitate extension through Lua bindings, it might be a good idea to copy Lua headers as well.

data.title: AnimatedSprite2D component just stops (should hide) when disabled.
data.body:
The follow code just stops the animation but can't hide it:

``` Lua
local ani = self.node:GetComponent('AnimatedSprite2D')
ani:SetEnabled(false)
```

but it should hide the animation as documented in [Scene model](http://urho3d.github.io/documentation/1.32/_scene_model.html) at the "Scene updates" section:

> Nodes and components can be excluded from the scene update by disabling them, see SetEnabled(). **Disabling for example a drawable component also makes it invisible**, a sound source component becomes inaudible etc. If a node is disabled, all of its components are treated as disabled regardless of their own enable/disable state.

BTW. the `StaticSprite2D` component does hidden when `SetEnabled(false)`.

data.title: Do not use globals for in LuaScriptObject
data.body:
As posted [here](http://urho3d.prophpbb.com/topic766.html)

Currently the lua script for a script object is like this:

``` Lua
-- Rotator.lua
Rotator = ScriptObject()
-- ...
```

And we get the `Rotator` object by passing the object name string to `LuaScriptInstance:CreateObject()` and then index it in global table `_G`.
This is fine, but could be better if we use require system or at least the script return value for getting the `Rotator` object:

``` Lua
-- Rotator.lua
local Rotator = ScriptObject()
-- ...

return Rotator
```

IMHO. this is better way.

data.title: Consider namespace in scripting?
data.body:
Currently Urho3D Lua scripting API (classes constants) are globals ( `_G` members).

eg.

``` Lua
function myfunction()
    scene = Scene() -- Scene is a global and luacheck can't handle this as know global.
   -- ...
end
```

That is, IMHO, not a good idea.

I think it is better to have all api in a table, maybe `urho3d` or `urho`.
And even submodules are better like `urho3d.io`, `urho3d.math` etc.

eg.

``` Lua
local Scene = urho3d.Scene
local function myfunction()
    local scene = Scene()
    -- ...
end
```

data.title: Fixed input lag
data.body:
Fixed an input lag that was especially noticable with vsync by switching from SDL_PeepEvents to SDL_PollEvent. Using OpenGL the lag is completely gone and with DirectX it's greatly reduced (and can be almost gone by setting max fps = refresh rate).

Note that the OpenGL version uses SDL_GL_SetSwapInterval while the DirectX version uses D3DPRESENT_INTERVAL_ONE to enable VSync. I haven't looked into it but it could be that SDL_GL_SetSwapInterval does some internal stuff that fix the lag with the input polling when using VSync, unlike the DirectX version.

Also the only sagnificant difference between SDL_PeepEvents and SDL_PollEvent is that SDL_PeepEvents is thread safe, tho it shouldn't matter because the event polling isn't threaded.

data.title: PhysicsWorld2D::RaycastSingle() issue
data.body:
When performing a single ray cast using PhysicsWorld2D::RaycastSingle() and nothing is hit by the ray, a PhysicsRaycastResult2D is reported anyway (with a VECTOR2::ZERO and no RigidBody2D).
Simple lua script to replicate:

``` lua
require "LuaScripts/Utilities/Sample"

function Start()
    SampleStart()
    CreateScene()
    SubscribeToEvents()
end

function CreateScene()
    scene_ = Scene()
    scene_:CreateComponent("Octree")
    scene_:CreateComponent("DebugRenderer")
    scene_:CreateComponent("PhysicsWorld2D")

    -- Camera
    cameraNode = Node()
    local camera = cameraNode:CreateComponent("Camera")
    renderer:SetViewport(0, Viewport:new(scene_, camera))
    camera.orthographic = true
    camera.orthoSize = graphics.height * PIXEL_SIZE
    camera.zoom = 1.2 * Min(graphics.width / 1280, graphics.height / 800)

    local boxSprite = cache:GetResource("Sprite2D", "Urho2D/Box.png")

    -- Ground
    local groundNode = scene_:CreateChild("Ground")
    groundNode.position = Vector3(0, -1, 0)
    groundNode.scale = Vector3(20, 1, 0)
    local groundBody = groundNode:CreateComponent("RigidBody2D")
    local groundShape = groundNode:CreateComponent("CollisionBox2D")
    groundShape.size = Vector2(0.32, 0.32)
    groundShape.friction = 0.5
    local groundSprite = groundNode:CreateComponent("StaticSprite2D")
    groundSprite.sprite = boxSprite

    -- Character
    characterNode = groundNode:Clone("Character")
    characterNode.position = Vector3(0, 1, 0)
    characterNode.scale = Vector3(1, 1, 0)
    local body = characterNode:GetComponent("RigidBody2D")
    body.bodyType = BT_DYNAMIC
    body.allowSleep = false
end

function SubscribeToEvents()
    SubscribeToEvent("Update", "HandleUpdate")
    SubscribeToEvent("PostRenderUpdate", "HandlePostRenderUpdate")
end

function HandleUpdate(eventType, eventData)
    -- Ray cast under character
    local raycastSingleResult = scene_:GetComponent("PhysicsWorld2D"):RaycastSingle(characterNode.worldPosition2D, characterNode.worldPosition2D - Vector2(0, 0.5))
    if raycastSingleResult then
        print(raycastSingleResult.position:ToString(), raycastSingleResult.body:GetNode().name)
    end
    -- Jump
    if input:GetKeyPress(KEY_SPACE) then
        characterNode:GetComponent("RigidBody2D"):ApplyForceToCenter(Vector2(0, 1000))
    end
    if input:GetKeyPress(KEY_Q) then
        characterNode:GetComponent("RigidBody2D").linearVelocity = Vector2.ZERO
        characterNode:GetComponent("RigidBody2D").angularVelocity = Vector2.ZERO
    end
end

function HandlePostRenderUpdate(eventType, eventData)
    scene_:GetComponent("PhysicsWorld2D"):DrawDebugGeometry(true)
end
```

PhysicsWorld2D::Raycast() works fine (doesn't report a PODVector<PhysicsRaycastResult2D> when nothing is hit by the ray, which is the expected behavior).

Not related but replicable in this sample:
- although the same force is applied to the body at each jump, jump height may vary significatively
- setting linearVelocity and angularVelocity once the body is moving has no effect

data.title: Render to texture with FBO
data.body:
I went through the source code of Urho3d but I couldn't find a relevant call to write Framebuffer to texture using glTexImage2D . The only place seems to be here: https://github.com/urho3d/Urho3D/blob/master/Source/Urho3D/Graphics/OpenGL/OGLTexture2D.cpp#L248
Where it doesn't seems to be affecting the render to texture using renderpath.
This is my reference as standard RTT with FBO: https://www.opengl.org/wiki/Framebuffer_Object_Examples

I also couldn't find where are we actually binding the texture to 2d sampler like sDepthBuffer or sDiffMap .

data.title: concatenating Urho3D::String with wchar_t
data.body:
Text *text ...
text->SetText("FPS: " + String(currentFps)); // working

Text *text ...
text->SetText(L" (Cyrillic text"): " + String(currentFps)); // error

///// workaround
Text *text ...
String str = L": "; // unnecessary var
text->SetText(str + String(currentFps));

data.body: Both pugixml and rapidjson seem to support setting arbitrary indentations so shouldn't be too big of a task.

data.title: Issue with tmx Polygon/Poly Line properties
data.body:
When creating a property for a 'Polygon' or 'Poly Line' Object in Tiled, nothing is rendered in Urho3D (black screen).

Steps to reproduce:
- open isometric_grass_and_water.tmx in Tiled
- create an 'Object' layer
- create a 'Polygon' or 'Poly Line' Object
- create a property for this Object
- save tmx file
- run sample 36_Urho2DTileMap

Note: works OK with 'Rectangle' and 'Ellipse' properties.

data.title: Cloning AnimatedSprite2D component issue
data.body:
When cloning a node with an AnimatedSprite2D component:
- animation is not playing for the clone
- when saving the scene and reloading, 2 weird sub-nodes are created (one with a StaticSprite2D)

This is certainly a collateral issue of the recent refactoring.

Simple lua script to replicate:

``` lua
require "LuaScripts/Utilities/Sample"

function Start()
    SampleStart()
    CreateScene()
    SubscribeToEvent("Update", "HandleUpdate")
end

function CreateScene()
    scene_ = Scene()
    scene_:CreateComponent("Octree")

    -- Camera
    cameraNode = Node() -- scene_:CreateChild("Camera")
    cameraNode.position = Vector3(0, 0, -10)
    local camera = cameraNode:CreateComponent("Camera")
    camera.orthographic = true
    camera.orthoSize = graphics.height * PIXEL_SIZE
    renderer:SetViewport(0,  Viewport:new(scene_, camera))

    -- Create coins
    local coin = CreateCoin()
    for i=1, 3 do
        local clone = coin:Clone()
        clone.position = Vector3(i, 0, -1)
    end
end

function CreateCoin()
    local spriteNode = scene_:CreateChild("Coin")
    spriteNode.position = Vector3(0, -2, -1)
    local animatedSprite = spriteNode:CreateComponent("AnimatedSprite2D")
    animatedSprite:SetAnimation(cache:GetResource("AnimationSet2D", "Urho2D/GoldIcon.scml"), "idle") -- Get scml file and Play "idle" anim
    return spriteNode
end

function HandleUpdate(eventType, eventData)
    if input:GetKeyPress(KEY_F5) then
        scene_:SaveXML(fileSystem:GetProgramDir().."Data/Scenes/TileMapOrtho.xml")
    end
    if input:GetKeyPress(KEY_F7) then
        scene_:LoadXML(fileSystem:GetProgramDir().."Data/Scenes/TileMapOrtho.xml")
    end
end
```

Note: I've tried to call engine:RunFrame() after each clone creation and I get the same result as when reloading.

data.title: Feature request: add sample with loading UI and scene from external files example
data.body: I was tried to do this, but saw only black screen and could't find code example to do such tasks in documentation and samples:  I found only UI style loading example. UI and scene objects seems to be hardcoded. See this thread: http://urho3d.prophpbb.com/topic696.html

data.title: changed the packed quaternion to half the size
data.body:
I changed the (de)serializer for the packed quaternion to use 4 instead of 8 bytes.
This is possible by reducing the depth for each component to 10 bits and only sending 3 components.
10 Bits seems to still be precise enough as to not notice any artifacts. 
Since the fourth component can be computed from the other 3 by using the knowledge that the quaternion is normalized it can be omitted.
By always sending the 3 smallest components the error when computing the fourth component is minimized.
The highest 2 bits are used to encode which of the 4 components was omitted.
The packed quaternion looks someting like this:
H------------------------------------------------L
oo|aaaaaaaaaa|bbbbbbbbbb|cccccccccc

where 
- o are the 2 bits for encoding the offset of the omitted component
- a, b and c are the components following the omitted one

I have tested this code with NinjaSnowWar as well as the SceneReplicationDemo and haven't noticed any issues or noticable loss of precision

data.title: WritePackedQuaternion always returns false
